definition: consultative conference (political venue during early communist rule)/consultative meeting/deliberative assembly
to cooperate/to harmonize/to help/to assist/to join
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Ren2 min2 Zheng4 zhi4 Xie2 shang1 Hui4 yi4
containing_words.word: 中国人民政治协商会议

sentences.english: Sai Sheng Murng, deputy spokesman of the Shan State Army-South, supported the call for a Panglong-type conference.
sentences.chinese: 南掸邦军副发言人宰盛蒙，支持召开彬龙型协商会议。

sentences.english: Welcome to Geneva, and welcome to a consultation with a transformative ambition.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎你们来日内瓦参加这次锐意改革的协商会议。

sentences.english: And it is on this foundation that the present People's Political Consultative Conference is convened .
sentences.chinese: 在这个基础上，召开了今天的人民政治面目协商会议。

sentences.english: Global governance of public health was part of the discussions during that meeting.
sentences.chinese: 公共卫生全球管理是协商会议讨论的一项内容。

definition: to call a conference/to convene a meeting
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
general congress/meeting of the whole committee
plenary session of the Central Committee
proposal/draft resolution/motion (to be debated)/to propose a bill/to make a proposal
